title.narrative: Finnpartnership: Sustainable home and interior textiles from Bhutan

description.narrative: The project aims at starting up an interior design company that cultivates and enhances the culture of craftsmanship as part of interior design of homes and public places. The company will offer interior design textiles produced in a sustainable manner fro m yak hair and ahimsa/eri silk in Bhutan. The purpose is to start producing the textiles at first from yak hair since it is domestically available in Bhutan and since the price of the textiles woven out of yak hair is affordable. In the future ahimsa/eri s ilk will be included as one of the fabrics in a product range. This will however require finding a producer committed to producing silk in a sustainable way in Assam India. A human rights based approach will be particularly emphasized when assessing and de veloping the sustainability of the supply chain instead of traditional business auditing.I have created Boutique Creative Insights as a sole proprietor for the purpose of making this project proposal and business plan. When actual business starts I will co nvert it into a limited company. My plan is to start small and first test products on the Finnish and European markets in order to see what kind of textiles will sell and then broaden the product range gradually. The textiles will be designed in Finland to suit western taste but ideas and patterns will be collected from an old Bhutanese textile tradition. The designs will be finalized with weavers in Bhutan. Within the project the purpose is to collaborate with local NGOs. In addition to offering textiles t he company will provide experiences such as workshops trainings and tailored textile tours through its local partners. On the tours the customers can visit 'production sites' and verify with their own eyes how and in what kind of conditions the textiles ar e produced. The aim is develop a long term business in which part of the profits will be directed to developing local communities and entrepreneurship. Within the project experiences and knowledge of starting and developing a sustainable human rights based business on the developing markets will be collected for sharing information on the topic in a visually interesting way on the Internet.
